headline: Waste Management Deepens Cash Returns While Advancing Renewable Gas Growth
summary: Waste Management, NYSE:WM, announced a 14.5% dividend increase. The company authorized a new $3 billion share repurchase program planned for 2026. Management highlighted record free cash flow, margin expansion, and new renewable natural gas facilities. Waste Management sits at a share price of $223.13, with a return of 55.5% over 3 years and 113.5% over 5 years. In that context, the latest dividend increase and new buyback plan add another layer of capital returns on top of the company’s...

headline: Waste Management Q4 Earnings Call Highlights

headline: WM Q4 Deep Dive: Margin Expansion and Cost Discipline Offset Revenue Miss
summary: Waste management services provider Waste Management (NYSE:WM) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, but sales rose 7.1% year on year to $6.31 billion. On the other hand, the company’s outlook for the full year was close to analysts’ estimates with revenue guided to $26.53 billion at the midpoint. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.93 per share was 0.9% below analysts’ consensus estimates.
